name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Kentucky research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Kentucky ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Kentucky ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Kentucky research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Kentucky research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Kentucky Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Get tips for starting Kentucky research.

    ☆ AR—Beginning to Search for Kentucky Ancestors
  3. Follow this research study for Kentucky ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Kentucky Research, 1880-Present

  4. Get an overview of Kentucky research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Kentucky Overview—1:51

  5. Ancestry: Explore resources for Kentucky research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Kentucky Resources
    ☆ AC—Kentucky State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  6. Record Finder: Use the Kentucky Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Kentucky Record Selection Table

    7. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Kentucky in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Kentucky
      ☆ FS—Wiki: Kentucky Minorities

    2. Learn more about African American records.

      ☆ FS—African American Resources for Kentucky
      ☆ AG—Kentucky African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for Kentucky.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Kentucky in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Kentucky
Additional Records

1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Kentucky archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Kentucky archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Kentucky archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Kentucky Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Kentucky State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the Kentucky Dept. for Libraries and Archives collection.
  3. Explore the Kentucky Dept of Archives site.
  4. Explore the Kentuckiana Digital Library site.
  5. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Kentucky genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  6. Search for ☆free online books on Kentucky research on the FamilySearch site.
  7. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Kentucky ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Kentucky city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Kentucky Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Kentucky city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Kentucky city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Kentucky ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Kentucky city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
QUIKLinks

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Kentucky research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Kentucky County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Kentucky.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Kentucky Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Kentucky research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Kentucky Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Kentucky History and Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Kentucky Genealogy page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the Kentucky Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  5. Visit the U.S. South Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  6. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Kentucky.
Regional Groups

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Kentucky research.
  2. Explore the Kentucky research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community for help with Kentucky research.
  4. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Kentucky research.

choices.name: Learn about Kentucky genealogy and historical societies.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.
